intro: Physopsis lachnostachya, commonly known as the golden beard grass, is a member of the Poaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant features slender, erect stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Physopsis lachnostachya is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
